name: Raspberry Digital Signage
short_description:
An operating system for digital signage on the Raspberry Pi, which handles both web and multimedia content.

1. WEB VIEW displays HTML pages from an Internet or LAN resource; it has three sub-views: you can choose between Firefox, Chromium and Midori; Midori also features  an Adobe Flash replacement: this is the only way to play Flash content on the R-Pi.

2. MEDIA VIEW can display both a slideshow of images and a video player of Internet or LAN files (http:// and https://).

Raspberry Digital Signage shows a full-screen view restricted to the web page/slideshow specified; there is no way to escape this view but rebooting the machine. It is a hacker-proof operating systems for indoor and outdoor use. 

It features wired/wireless networking, proxy, on-screen keyboard and more. SSH logins.
.

If you need images slideshow only, see  www.binaryemotions.com/raspberry-slideshow instead.
If you need video playback only, see www.binaryemotions.com/raspberry-video instead.
summary: Digital signage for the Raspberry Pi (model A, B, B+ and 2)
